intro: Primula officinalis subf. varia, commonly known as the variable primrose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters, featuring basal rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, brightly colored flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. Its flowers are not only ornamental but also have historical uses in herbal medicine.
